titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Phoebus A.T. Levene papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff FA174

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-04-06 02:00:45 -0400.

change.item: Paper finding aid converted to EAD/XML by AureXus in 2010. Imported into the Archvists’ Toolkit by Becky Robbins.

did.unittitle: Phoebus A.T. Levene papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Phoebus Aaron Theodor Levene, 1869-1940, physician and chemist in proteins and nucleic acids, carbohydrates and lipoids at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research until his death in 1940.

eventgrp.event: M.D. Imperial Military Medical Academy, St. Petersburg
Arrived in the United States Practiced medicine
Associate in chemistry, State Pathological Institute, New York
Chemist, Saranac Laboratory for Study of Tuberculosis, Saranac, New York
Herter Lecturer in pathological chemistry, New York University, New York
Assistant in Chemistry, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York, New York
Willard Gibbs Medal, American Chemical Society, Chicago section
William H. Nichols Medal, American Chemical Society, New York sect.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Van der Scheer-Landsteiner Peptides - Bergmann Carbobenzoxy Method (Note: Given to R. Bruce Merrifield 8/13/84 as historical materials by H.W. Chase).

row.entry: d, l- Leucyl-glycyl-glycine methyl ester. HC1
Made with Cbzo glycyl-glycine azide and leucyl-glycyl-glycine

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Please note that [xx] is used within this finding aid to refer to molecular, chemical, or atomic structure diagrams in the original paper finding aid.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: biographical material, correspondence, notes, reports, lecture material, and glass slides.

did.unittitle: Biographical items; photographs, bibliography, administrative correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One box of material consists primarily of administrative correspondence between P.A.T. Levene and Simon Flexner and the Business Manager during 35 years at The Rockefeller Institute. One folder is devoted to biographical items including photographs of Levene, of his laboratory, some of the workers in his laboratory and a photograph of Dr. Levene with Pavlov and Pavlov's son and Simon Flexner. Also included is a photographic copy of a signed book prepared by his associates and presented on his 70th birthday; obituary items; funeral arrangements and list of books presented to the Institute by Mrs. Levene at the time of Dr. Levene's death.
Includes NAS BIOGRAPHICAL MEMOIR by D.D. Van Slyke and Walter Jacobs V. 23 (1944).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related items can be found in the following Record Groups: 210. 3 (1); Acetone (listing also place in P.A.T. Levene Papers); 210. 3 (17) Levene, P.A.T. Requests for chemicals 210.3 (18).

Note: At the New York Public Library, Mss and Archive Division (Annex Building, W. 43rd St.) Box 195 Emergency Committee in Aid of Displaced Foreign Scholars contains a collection of Levene correspondence with foreign scholars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Include a number of handwritten items.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The following correspondence files were kept in manila envelopes or packages; original labels are included in the new folders wherever possible. The files have been rearranged in alphabetical order.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Box 9: From P.A. Levene filing cabinet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Pincussen article" [1929 review, in German, by Levene. The following folders were found in a package, wrapped and tied in brown paper, and labeled "Pincussen article." The titles listed below were copied from the original folders, with some abridgement of section numbers/letters. They have been rearranged to simplify retrieval.].

did.unittitle: Products of complete hydrolysis of Lecithin and Cephalin
Products of intermediate hydrolysis of Lecithin and Cephalin
Purinamidases 1) Prep, of Extracts 2) Analytical procedure

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stencilled copies of April reports to Board of Scientific Directors, RIMR.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [The material below was found tied together in folders and envelopes. The papers consist of manuscript drafts, data, and notes. The titles have been copied from the original labels; the folders have, however, been rearranged into alphabetical order by author, where a name was indicated, or by subject title. The last two folders appear to be an exception to the "unfinished" class, as they contain galleys as well as mss (work of A.L. Raymond, submitted from Caltech); also see folder 3].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [But see note on cover: "Dr. Levene says this work has been published. May 1939"].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [The material in boxes 12-16 consists of manuscripts of P.A. Levene publications: 2 articles with A. Rothen, and the monograph on Nucleic Acids with L. Bass. Most of the mss. were in well-labeled 3-ring binders. The titles are taken from the original labels. C. Kopp, 13 Aug 1985].
